授業目的: The purpose of this course is to guide students towards gaining and being able to demonstrate a critical and practical understanding of key concepts from the field of Organizational Behaviour (OB).  A theme running though the course explores and illustrates how OB can be applied strategically towards managing and leading organizational change. In support of each participating student’s professional development, the course provides opportunities for students individually and in teams to rehearse and perform roles as consultants to organizations seeking to change established behaviours.
到達目標:
After working actively and collaboratively though this course, students should be able to demonstrate:
?An informed and critical understanding of key concepts from the field of Organizational Behaviour (OB).
?An informed and practical understanding of how OB concepts might be applied strategically in processes of managing and leading organizational change.
?Practical insights into how consultants, who might be either external and / or internal to a particular organization, might act as ‘agents’ of behavioural change in these organizations with the effect of improving the relative business performance of these organizations.

Note: The instructor has designed this course on the assumption that some students may have no prior knowledge or experience of OB theory or practice.

評価.成績評価Grading3:
備考　Note
Two in-class quizzes (20%). The two quizzes (each worth a maximum 10% of individual student assessment) will be time-limited open book examinations. In these quizzes, students will be tested individually on their conceptual and practical understanding of key OB concepts that have been discussed during the early stages of the course.

Team presentation (30%). As a consequence of their individual quiz scores, the instructor will allocate students towards forming an OB ‘consultancy’ team. The instructor will then allocate each team a task that guides them systematically towards developing a structured analysis of a selected organization’s behaviour. Each team presents the results of their analysis in class. The instructor will give feedback to each team as part-preparation for their final examination: Team Report.

Final Report (50%)Team members are selected by the instructor.
Individual team members collaborate towards researching, writing and submitting a team report (50%). Each team is guided towards building upon the research, analysis and feedback they received during the above-mentioned team presentation process before writing and submitting a Final Report. The format and style of this Final Report simulate those that business consultants routinely use when preparing reports and guidelines for action for their client organizations. The instructor will provide each team with a template for this type of consultancy report along with a detailed briefing about the template can be used prior to beginning their work on this final assessment.
Note: The grades awarded to the team as a whole will become the individual grades awarded to each team member.
